meanings.definition: Having a crisp texture or sound when bitten or crushed.
meanings.sent1: The apple was crunchier than the soft banana.
meanings.sent2: The chips were crunchier than the crackers.
meanings.sent3: The crunchier popcorn made the movie experience more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her footsteps on the snow were like crunchier whispers in the night.
meanings.sent5: The crunchier leaves underfoot signaled the arrival of autumn.

meanings.definition: More likely to make a crunching sound.
meanings.sent1: The cereal was crunchier than the oatmeal.
meanings.sent2: The gravel road was crunchier than the paved street.
meanings.sent3: The crunchier chips seemed to sing a crunchy melody.
meanings.sent4: His crunchier footsteps echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The crunchier branches swayed in the wind, creating a crunchy symphony.

meanings.sent1: The fresh vegetables were crunchier than the soggy ones.
meanings.sent2: The cookies were crunchier than the cake.
meanings.sent3: The crunchier granola bar seemed to mock the softer ones.
meanings.sent4: Her crunchier salad was a refreshing burst of texture.
meanings.sent5: The crunchier nuts added a satisfying crunch to the trail mix.
